importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article was updated on this date, indicating the latest developments regarding the potential Trump-Putin summit.
The current timeline of the pre-meeting being tabled occurs in this week, signaling a delay in diplomatic efforts to resolve the Ukraine war.
More than two months prior to the current date, Trump previously held an in-person summit with Putin in Anchorage, Alaska, which ended without a deal.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The anticipated pre-meeting between US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov was scheduled for this week, but has now been tabled for next week, indicating a delay in diplomatic coordination.

keyTakeAways: President Donald Trump expressed hope for a summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin to address the ongoing war in Ukraine.

A pre-meeting between key foreign affairs aides, specifically Marco Rubio and Sergey Lavrov, was scheduled for this week but has been postponed due to differing views on ending Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Rubio and Lavrov had a phone call earlier in the week discussing potential steps toward ending the war, but officials believe the Russian position remains maximalist and unevolved.
Rubio is not currently recommending the Trump-Putin summit move forward, though future talks between the two officials remain possible.
Trump has consistently advocated for an immediate ceasefire and has urged both Kyiv and Moscow to stop the war, emphasizing that peace should be established at the battle line.
The previous in-person Trump-Putin summit occurred more than two months ago in Anchorage, Alaska, and ended without a concrete agreement.
The Kremlin described the Rubio-Lavrov call as a constructive discussion, but US officials believe it did not yield sufficient progress.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump is the central figure in the article, advocating for a diplomatic resolution to the Russia-Ukraine war and pushing for a summit with Putin.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Putin
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Putin is the key counterpart to Trump in the proposed summit and central to discussions on ending the war in Ukraine.

namedEntities.name: Marco Rubio
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Secretary of State of the United States
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rubio is the lead US official in the proposed pre-summit meeting with Russia’s foreign minister, Sergey Lavrov.

namedEntities.name: Sergey Lavrov
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Lavrov is the Russian counterpart to Rubio in the pre-summit discussion and represents Russia’s position on ending the war in Ukraine.

namedEntities.name: Hungary
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Budapest, Hungary, is the proposed location for the Trump-Putin summit, making it a key geopolitical venue.

namedEntities.name: Anchorage, Alaska
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This was the site of Trump’s last in-person summit with Putin, which occurred over two months ago and ended without a deal.

namedEntities.name: Kyiv
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kyiv is referenced as the Ukrainian capital involved in the ongoing war with Russia, central to the peace discussions.

summaryOfNewsArticle: President Donald Trump continues to push for a summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin to end Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, but hopes for a quick meeting may be stalled after a planned pre-meeting between US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov was tabled due to divergent views on ending the war. Rubio and Lavrov had previously discussed steps toward peace, but officials believe Russia’s position remains maximalist and has not evolved sufficiently. While the Trump-Putin summit in Budapest, Hungary, remains a possibility, the delay in the pre-meeting suggests significant diplomatic challenges, especially regarding the war’s endgame. Trump has consistently called for an immediate ceasefire and has emphasized that peace should be established at the battle line, underscoring his commitment to peace despite past summit failures.
title: Trump’s hope for quick second summit with Putin may be stalled as pre-meeting tabled for now
